cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem
Interface Fitness

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseFitness, BucketFitness, JobShopFitness, KnapsackFitness, SATFitness, TSPFitness
public interface Fitness

Fitness is used to give an attributes' quality a numeric value. Higher values means better configurations, while lower means worse.

Every problem has its default fitness, used as pitfall if no other is specified. This is retrieved by Problem.getDefaultFitness().

Algorithm may however choose to use different fitness instead. Also, solver is able to change fitness used in optimization process.

Rule of thumb is that highest priority has solver setting. If no one is set, algorithm's own fitness is used. If algorithm has no specific fitness for this problem, then problem's default fitness is used.

In order to achieve this, every algorithm should either take defaultFitness or supply its own in Algorithm.init(ObjectiveProblem). Then Solver may call Algorithm.setFitness(Fitness) to override its value.

 double getValue(Configuration configuration)
          Measures fitness for one configuration.
